definition: to get rid of/to weed out/to reject
to push up one's sleeves/to reject or resist/to seize/to perturb/to steal
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including
to drive out devils and spirits exorcism
state/country/the Gods of earth and grain
lit. to rescue the people from hanging upside down (idiom, from Mencius); to save the people from dire straits
Tartar (derogatory)/also used as an insulting term for Manchus around 1900
to bring peace and stability to the country
to ward off calamities/to avoid disaster
the whole world at peace (idiom); peace and prosperity
to console the people by punishing the tyrants (idiom)
(literary) foreign aggression/external threat/humiliation inflicted by outsiders
